thread.title: BostInno Approved: What To Do This Weekend, 10/9/15
thread.title_full: BostInno Approved: What To Do This Weekend, 10/9/15

author: Kate Lofblad
title: BostInno Approved: What To Do This Weekend, 10/9/15
text:
share Attendees at last year's WZLX Craft Beer Experience. 
Want events and other Boston news delivered to your inbox bright and early each morning? Of course you do – sign up for our lifestyle newsletter, In The Know, right here . Looking for tech networking events? Here . OK. 
It’s a ~3 day weekend~ work hard, play hard people. Friday HONK! Festival - Friday to Sunday - A giant dance party takes over Somerville! HONK! is a 3-day free festival bringing brass bands from all over the United States and the world to Boston to celebrate music, community and activism. Prepare your eardrums. 100.7 FM WZLX Boston’s Classic Rock and Craft Beer Cellar Present the “WZLX Craft Beer Experience” - Cyclorama - Friday: 6 to 9p.m., Saturday: 2p.m. to 5p.m. and 6p.m. to 9p.m. - Great music, and 2oz samples of over 120 beers and ciders to try? Done and done. Tickets are $45 in advance, $50 day of the event. HUBweek Block Party / ' Color War' on the Greenway Echelman Sculpture - Dewey Square Park on the Rose Kennedy Greenway - 5 to 8p .m. / 7 to 9 p.m. - Grab your work friends, take a later train out of South Station and spend Friday night blowing off some steam at Dewey Square. There'll be music, lawn games, food trucks, photobooth, $4 beer/wine. Sponsored by IdeaPaint. Grab a dry-erase marker and help illustrate a massive IdeaWall mural. Then at 7, light up Janet Echelman's aerial sculpture, suspended 300 feet over the Greenway, using your cell phone. It's a farewell party until 9 p.m. for the sculpture, which is scheduled to come down Oct. 25. All free. Saturday Illuminus Boston - Landsdowne St. - 6:30p.m. to 12:30a.m. - Illuminus is taking over Fenway. Where there is usually hotdog stands and popcorn there will be unique art installations and performances by artists "who manipulate light, sound, and projection to create an immersive, multi-sensory spectacle." This not-your-average-Fenway-experience attracted over 10,000 spectators last year. Must be doing something right, right? It's free. Punkin’ Fest - Lawn on D - Noon to 10p.m. - Who cares that Halloween is still three weeks away? Carving a giant vegetable into a haphazard face is always fun. Lawn on D will provide the pumpkins and carving materials. All pumpkins will be added to a “colossal illuminated Punkin' Manor” that will cast a spooky glow from LOD all weekend long. There will also be pumpkin bowling. Pumpkin. Bowling. Free. Rocky Horror Picture Show - the Mendon Twin Drive-In - Starts at 6p.m. - Just because summer is over doesn’t mean summer activities need to end. Grab a blanket and some hand warmers and get ready to get spooked at the Mendon Twin Drive-In. This weekend they’re playing back to back classic horror movies. Friday and Sunday feature Silence of the Lambs and The Shining while Saturday is a Rocky Horror Picture show and Beetlejuice kind of night. $25 for up to six people packed into your car. The Great Pumpkin Bar Crawl - Meet at Loretta's Last Call - 2pm - A bar crawl AND a scavenger hunt. Before you can move onto your next location you and your teammate have to solve a challenge or trivia question. Teams of two or three at $10 per ticket includes 20% off food at Loretta's, crawl t-shirt and access to Downeast swag giveaways and prizes. The 4th Annual Boston Winter Film Festival - Various Locations and times - Can't wait for ski season for your next adrenaline rush? The annual ski, snowboard and outdoor film festival is BACK. General admission tickets are $20 and includes a buy-one-get-one to Sunday River, courtesy drinks for 21+, Spy swag, and a shred DVD. VIP tickets are $35 and also include a Killington 2 for 1 Lift Ticket. Sunday The Opposite of Loneliness: Essays and Stories - The Coop - If you haven’t already read it, Marina Keegan’s The Opposite of Loneliness: Essays and Stories is an incredibly well-written collection written by a 2012 Yale grad. Tragically, she died just five days after her graduation but her memory is lived on by her excellent book. Excerpts of which will be read aloud by her former teachers Anne Fadiman and Beth McNamara. Free. Oktoberfest Beer Hall - Beat Brasserie - 11a.m. to 1a.m. - Didn't want to leave Cambridge to enjoy one of Boston’s six billion Octoberfests? Fear not. Beat Brasserie transforms into a Bavarian Beer Hall for the 37th Annual Harvard Square Oktoberfest on Sunday. Complete with “community tables, German music, food, lederhosen, dirndls and beer.”
